free_text.Learning outcomes: The objectives of the course are to introduce to the student the state of the art in various advanced topics of research (listed below in the content section) in the area of computer aided design and manufacturing. The student will familiarize himself/herself with the basic concepts, methods of approach and the available literature. Theoretical exercises and/or oral student research paper presentations will complement the learning of the material. Topics from the list will be offered selectively each year.
free_text.Content: [li]Process planning models and generation and evaluation algorithms[br/][li]Computer-aided tolerancing[br/][li]Toolpath generation and simulation[br/][li]STEP data models[br/][li]Reverse engineering[br/][li]Machine tool command generation[br/][br/]Supervisor : Prof. P. Xirouchakis
free_text.Note: Computer-aided manufacturing, virtual manufacturing, manufacturing optimization
free_text.Required prior knowledge: A course in computer-aided design and manufacturing

free_text.Remarque: Computer-aided manufacturing, virtual manufacturing, manufacturing optimization
